artist: Artist: Shunkōsai Hokushū; Publisher: Izutsuya Denbei
creditline: The M. Boyd and Carol Burton Endowment
description:
triptych in inverted T shape; top image (a):  two figures on a balcony; standing man at right pouring brown liquid down from a small brown pitcher; man wearing kimono with yellow feather and scroll patterns and grey tassels at hem; upside down figure wearing black garments and straw sandals, reaching out across floor of balcony with PL hand
lower left image (b):  standing female with long ponytail wearing a pink kimono with yellow waves and birds at hem; obi has large crab at back; figure is looking at text written in liquid by man on balcony; screen (?) in background with patterns of white and blue birds and spiral elements
lower right image (c):  standing man holding a lantern aloft in his PR hand; man wearing a black kimono with grey tassels at hem; screen (?) in background with patterns of white and blue birds and spiral elements
dimension: 14 1/2 × 10 in. (36.83 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban)
medium: Woodblock prints (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper with mica
signed: 春好斎北洲画 {Shunkōsai Hokushū ga}
text: Related to the play "Keisei Ōmonguchi" けいせい廓大門 (The Great Gate of the Licensed Quarter), performed at the Kado Theater, Osaka, in 1823 (Bunsei 6), 1st month.
title: Actors Nakamura Utaemon III as Mino no Shōkurō, Ichikawa Ebijūrō I as Gantetsu, actually Miura Arajirō, and Nakamura Karoku I as the Prostitute Hinazuru, actually Shōkurō’s wife Kochō
